name: debarking, hardwood, azobe | sawlog and veneer log, azobe, debarked, measured as solid wood | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/27205/documentation

This dataset represents debarking of one m3 of azobe wood from Central Africa. The Azobe trees are produced by (close to) sustainable forest management in Central Africa. ;No data on debarking of azobe wood is available; thus, average European data for debarking pine in the forest is used, taking into account the modern equipment of the logging company. Emissions from biomass burning are according to literature values. ;As inventory data availability on tropical forestry processes and tropical wood is very limited, the inventory should be considered case-specific. Any specific environmental impact from land use change following timber harvesting needs to be considered on a case-specific basis.

From debarking process of harvested azobe trees, at plantation site.

This activity ends with the debarked Azobe log at forest road. The dataset includes debarking and natural decomposition of the bark
category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/02:Forestry and logging/022:Logging/0220:Logging

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: data for debarking in Africa is not available - instead, European processes are used, taking into account of the modern equipment used for harvesting.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: The dataset reflects a high technological standard for debarking. The transportation processes are average for transportation to Europe; transport distance however can vary. The high technological standard and legal operations of this dataset cannot be assumed to be representative for azobe harvesting. Site-specific data for debarking is not available but takes place before shipping the logs to Europe, thus European data for debarking pine used. The resulting bark is left to rot.

exchanges.description: Reference product. The reference product being imported is azobe legs that are harvested from (close to) sustainable forest management in Central Africa. Data based on given reference.

flow.name: sawlog and veneer log, azobe, debarked, measured as solid wood
flow.category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/02:Forestry and logging/022:Logging/0220:Logging

exchanges.description: Proxy. Refers to debarking before maritime transportations; estimated based on direct use of European data (according to given Source).
